sentences.english: I can resist everything except temptation" is a very interesting epigram ."
sentences.chinese: “除了誘惑我什麼都能夠抵制”是句非常有趣的雋語。

sentences.english: Thus, in the ordinary course of warehousing, the temptations to embezzle are strictly limited.
sentences.chinese: 所以在普通倉庫的運作中，侵佔的誘惑被嚴格限制了。

sentences.english: Desire. It's an emotion designed to lead us astray.
sentences.chinese: 慾望，是誘惑我們誤入歧途的情感。

sentences.english: You are that has enticed even time calling in Tokyo "the labor cane" the woman?
sentences.chinese: 誘惑了甚而時間叫在東京“辛苦藤莖”婦女的您是？

sentences.english: Keep your attention on a woman's eyes and she'll let you know when the opportunity to seduce her is present.
sentences.chinese: 注意女人的眼睛，她會告訴你啥時誘惑她正當時。

sentences.english: Charm is the ultimate weapon, the supreme seduction, against which there are few defenses.
sentences.chinese: 魅力是終極武器，是極度誘惑，並且它天下無敵。

sentences.english: Jo Leonard: “Who can resist the sound of the first ice-cream van of the season?”
sentences.chinese: 誰能經得住這個季節裏第一輛冰淇淋車到來的誘惑？

sentences.english: Only a small number of dead enders were still in his thrall.
sentences.chinese: 只有少數人死亡的誘惑仍然在他的崇信。

sentences.english: Sales are about seducing the customer.
sentences.chinese: 營銷是誘惑消費者的方法。

sentences.english: Not even the most dedicated person is immune to the temptation of occasional chitchat.
sentences.chinese: 即使是最專注的人也禁不起偶爾聊天的誘惑。

sentences.english: Even if it's a little stale, it can be hard to resist.
sentences.chinese: 就算有點變味了，但也還是很難抵制它的誘惑。

sentences.english: And they glanced around so seductively in their humiliation in search of a buyer !
sentences.chinese: 在這樣的羞恥中，他們又是那樣的誘惑着尋找買家。

sentences.english: When nothing tempts you to stray.
Left alone with him, she entices José with suggestions of a rendezvous that night.
sentences.chinese: 在與賀塞獨處時，卡門誘惑賀塞在晚上與她幽會。

sentences.english: Of course willpower is not all there is to resisting temptation.
sentences.chinese: 當然光靠毅力來抵制誘惑是不夠的。

sentences.english: Agonistic logics, logics of ritual and seduction. , are stronger than sex.
sentences.chinese: 競爭邏輯，典禮和誘惑的邏輯，比性的更強。

definition: to coerce (sb into doing sth bad)/to lure (into a trap)/to seduce
to conceal/to hide behind/to cover up
to resist/to hold back/to stop/to ward off/to withstand
to test/to put to the test/trial/ordeal
to have an urge/to be impetuous/impulse/urge
helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
